comments.body: tempted to 'reverse' the order as the prompt is more likely to exist in the last portion of the output

I suppose I could, but not sure what that would get us.  We're going to test them all anyway, and if any are True it will pass.

Before we did: `line[0] or line[-1]`

This just ensures that if there were more than 2 lines, it would still check them all.
ah, thought that `any` would exit on the first 'true'
any() (and all()) do short-circuit and the CPython unittests check that the code short-circuits as of Python-2.7 and Python-3.2: http://bugs.python.org/issue17255
